rawText:
LABORATORY REPORT

Patient: Jane Doe
DOB: 01/15/1985
Date of Collection: 12/20/2024
Ordering Physician: Dr. Smith

=== COMPLETE BLOOD COUNT (CBC) ===

WBC (White Blood Cells): 7.2 x10^9/L (Normal: 4.5-11.0)
RBC (Red Blood Cells): 4.8 x10^12/L (Normal: 4.0-5.5)
Hemoglobin: 14.2 g/dL (Normal: 12.0-16.0)
Hematocrit: 42% (Normal: 36-46%)
Platelet Count: 250 x10^9/L (Normal: 150-400)
MCV: 88 fL (Normal: 80-100)
MCH: 29.6 pg (Normal: 27-33)

=== COMPREHENSIVE METABOLIC PANEL ===

Glucose, Fasting: 98 mg/dL (Normal: 70-99)
BUN (Blood Urea Nitrogen): 18 mg/dL (Normal: 7-20)
Creatinine: 0.9 mg/dL (Normal: 0.6-1.2)
eGFR: >90 mL/min (Normal: >60)

=== LIPID PANEL ===

Total Cholesterol: 210 mg/dL (Desirable: <200)
LDL Cholesterol: 130 mg/dL (Optimal: <100, Near Optimal: 100-129)
HDL Cholesterol: 55 mg/dL (Normal: >40 for men, >50 for women)
Triglycerides: 125 mg/dL (Normal: <150)

=== LIVER FUNCTION TESTS ===

ALT (Alanine Aminotransferase): 28 U/L (Normal: 7-56)
AST (Aspartate Aminotransferase): 24 U/L (Normal: 10-40)
Alkaline Phosphatase: 68 U/L (Normal: 44-147)
Total Bilirubin: 0.8 mg/dL (Normal: 0.1-1.2)
Albumin: 4.2 g/dL (Normal: 3.5-5.5)

=== THYROID PANEL ===

TSH (Thyroid Stimulating Hormone): 2.1 mIU/L (Normal: 0.4-4.0)
Free T4: 1.2 ng/dL (Normal: 0.8-1.8)

=== INTERPRETATION ===

Most values are within normal limits. Total Cholesterol is slightly elevated at 210 mg/dL. LDL Cholesterol is at the upper end of near-optimal range. Recommend dietary modifications and follow-up lipid panel in 3-6 months.

=== NOTE ===

Results should be interpreted by a qualified healthcare provider in the context of the patient's overall health status and medical history.

previewTerm.definition: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, often called 'bad' cholesterol because high levels can lead to plaque buildup in arteries.
